summary: Ray Breslin manages an elite team of security specialists trained in the art of breaking people out of the world's most impenetrable prisons. When his trusted operative, Shu Ren, is kidnapped and disappears inside the most elaborate prison ever built, Ray assembles an elite team to assist in the rescue.

reviews.content: The first film is under-rated. The sequels have no reason to exist. Where there’s more screen time for tv show actors, than Stallone or Bautista.

a half baked under budget nonsense which is almost unrelated to the original. the plot does not make any sense , PS2 level of CGI , bad editing, i guess the whole project was put to action by 2 separated teams who had no idea what the hell was the other team doing. this is a disgrace to the original. i feel i lost e few IQ points just by watching this.

It's like a downward spiral all along going from bad to worse to terrible every second. It's like taking a piece from 8000 puzzle boxes and dumping them together to sell one. It's like a badly made goulash that would make Gordon Ramsey puke. It's like a freight train wreck carrying a dude missile. It's makes my favorite popcorn taste bad. It's like taking a Van Gogh painting and defacing it increasingly worse unless only final remaining missing piece is a Michael Bay touch. It's what Ramses II would do after he time traveled to medieval England and stole a bluenprint of a drawn and quartering Catherine wheel and implemented back home. It's what aliens have on a bad trip. It's like a frill-necked lizard with an ear growing out of it's body. It is so botched it actually looks like a Kirchner painting. At my death bed, I would be ruing and reminiscing that only if I had put this 90 odd minutes to doing something I love!
DO NOT WASTE TIME WATCHING THIS. B movie all the way

Once Upon a Time,
The demigods came to Pan and they yelled "Come OM! Hades is such a prick!" to which Pan replied, "Of course he's a prick! All worms wear my magic wand on their outsides!" but the demigods were very upset. So, Pan fell inside her own darkness once again to investigate what had happened when her beloved head worm Hades took over while she was away having a very long and much needed nap.

Hades told Pan her demigod kids were overreacting. He had come up with a perfect system of organization, motivation, and a great illusion called "security", which gave purpose and hope to all the children instead of letting them mindlessly churn in delusional creativity which was her destructive vice. Didn't she want her kids to be productive and happy? 

Pan agreed to monitor the children to see if what Hades said was true, and she did witness all kinds of bad childish behavior, and ultimately understood why Hades chose the punishments he did, as he even put a mirror up to Pan to show her when she too deserved such criticism. Pan agreed Hades wasn't evil, but his system of organization caused too much suffering, so she put a spell on the planet to relieve his slaves and let her nature reorganize according to more immaterial planes...like clouds. 

Of course Hades was very scared that Pan wanted to move her children into immaterial realms he couldn't control and whined "My whole Pyramid scheme will collapse!" as he had control over the rich. Pan assured him "My spell allows for a very smooth transition of power. Once everyone experiences this new way of living my beloved Hades, you will have much more time to pay attention to your pain-tings and our children will live to share their art with one another which will allow them to enjoy constant transformation."

Pan kissed Hades and left a love note for the kids "Don't be jerks, but do enjoy my dark seas. Also, Hades and I agree the Government will be sending out tax bills or withholding and won't mire you with paperwork when they don't have the staffing to handle such antiquated ways of organization. You probably think I wasn't interested in such boring affairs when crafting my future spells, but, you were never supposed to kill Time with paperwork, a huge mistake there. Lots of Love, Pan."
There was way too sci Fi and cgi for me. It was like a far cry from the 1st movie.
don't waste ur time. i love stallone but that was bad

Give me a break with the nonsense ratings. Stallone's Escape Plan and Expendables series are some of the most straight up and refreshing action films of 30 years... consistent quality, scripts, acting, casting (superb), and production values.  Beats most movies out there including inconsistent and often terrible Statham and others' films.  Get a grip.  Solid.  Escape Plan Hades
I'd pay to see 5 more in the series.
Great movie to watch with your friends and family.

Escape Plan 2: Hades is a Stallone film filled with action and nonsense with very few dialogue. Stallone's sequel excludes Arnold but his elite group includes Jesse Metcalfe, Dave Bautista, Wes Chatham, and Xiaoming Huang  who brought another element to the team.  Another prison break movie but this time one of the members gets captured in a high security technologically advanced system created by Wes who betrays Breslin and treats the prisoners as animals in a zoo.  50 Cent and Jaime King return to reprise their roles as we find Jaime married to Stallone.  Overall terrible sequel with little very little acting and horrible storyline. This was a low budgeted, B rated movie with a good cast.

Pretty much a very lame rehash of the first movie, minus Arnold sub in Dave Bautista but with an unknown Chinese martial arts guy as basically the main star. Also another case of the Chinese film industry producing another crappy movie in the US. Some of the action scenes were decent at best, but man..  what a waste.
I really really wanted to like this after enjoying the first one. was excited to see Batista (Dave Bautista) but I feel like I was not impressed

This is an incomprehensible, woeful, sloppy and downright bad action movie. First Escape Plan was good, but this sequel sucks. Easily one of the worst action movies ever. The editing is so bad, that it makes Taken 3 look look good by comparison. The saddest thing that it was released in 2018, which was a good year for movies.

Holy fucking shit this was SO BAD

And so the movie jumps from here to there, with no flow at all.

Sylvester Stallone should retire before he embarrass himself more with crappy movies like this.

A low-budget straight to video sequel, Escape Plan 2: HADES is a major departure from the original.  While attending a bachelor party with his cousin, Breslin Security consultant Shu is abducted and held prisoner at a black site called HADES, and while he works to escape his team realizes what's happened and starts looking for him.  The plot doesn't make a whole lot of sense and is full of bad clichés.  Sylvester Stallone takes a backseat to Chinese marshal artist/film star Huang Xiaoming, who really doesn't have any charisma.  Also joining the cast are David Bautistia and Jaime King.  Escape Plan 2: HADES has none of the tension and suspense of the first film, and nothing fresh or exciting to offer.
A rushed and unnecessary sequel. But it's worth 94 minutes of your time

Part 2 was a bit God awful! Had it been a little more like the orignal, with a few added plot to it, it would have been great! But then they introduced this lame new guy and just totally ruined this movie! And seeing the price tag to make this film, I must say epic/major fail!

The whole movie was some next level hot trash. This movie has destroyed my nice impression for the first movie, which was an actually nice movie.

Escape Plan 2 is a terrible watch, the movie does have decent star cast but that's about it all. The script, direction, plot and even the action were a disaster. Waste of time.

Messy plot line with an un-imaginative script with a cliff hanger which should just be left as such. The premise of this film is interesting but the execution is of something that would be deemed "passable" by teachers in a high school.

This is a movie that manages to hold the audiences attention for the first five minutes of its run time and only the first five minutes of its run time.

As soon as Stallone's character - no offense to the big guy - appears on screen, this movie descends into this boring, toneless, and barely comprehensible mess that suffers from its inability to properly balance its large cast. Bautista, especially, was sidelined in such a way that his character could have easily been removed halfway through production without affecting the movie at all.

And the lack of Sylvester Stallone/Arnold Schwarzenegger interactions does not in fact cover up the fact that Escape Plan 2's basic plot is a carbon copy of its predecessor's. If anything, it only makes it more obvious.
Impressively shite! I'd recommend sandpapering your eyes instead as it's likely to be more enjoyable. Not a patch on the first movie which itself was a crock

After watching the first movie, I was just so pumped to see the sequel: ESCAPE PLAN 2: HADES. And I really enjoyed it. Although not as good as the first, ESCAPE PLAN 2 still does meet the criteria of a good prison-break story: impossible odds stacked against the hero, teamwork and unbelievable timing. Look, this movie is not the best Sylvester Stallone film out there, and I get that. But you can't deny that it still does deliver in terms of thrills.
Such a disappointment after a decent predecessor.

I'm talking lens flares outside, lens flares inside, lens flares from desk lamps, there are lens flares INSIDE of vans. JJ Abrams called and said, "Whoa, that's too much."

Escape Plan 2: Hades: 3 out of 10:  Sylvester Stallone runs a firm that breaks people out of prison. After a job goes bad the team breaks up only to be brought back together when a new secret prison, the titular Hades, threatens one of their own. 

The Good: Dave Bautista is fun for the three minutes or so he is in the movie.
 
I also like the way the sets are a throwback to the Full Moon pictures of the 1980's with all the neon and bad special effects. 

The Bad: Dave Bautista is the only fun interesting character in the movie. The way he has been arguing with Disney we may see him in a lot more direct to video films like this. His loss is honestly our gain.

The movie Cube managed a much more effective future prison look on a much smaller budget twenty years ago. I found the sets and special effects hilariously bad. I am not sure the filmmakers really meant that.

The Ugly: To say this movie's plot makes no sense is an understatement. The futuristic prison contains advanced technology (healing robots, virtual reality etc) that is certainly more profitable to market to the outside world than the current kidnap people and makes them fight so they will reveal the industrial secrets business plan. It is like one of those movies where the bad guy invents a ray that can control the weather and then decided to use it to rob a bank.

In Conclusion: I have not seen the first Escape Plan but I understand it isn't that bad a movie. Why they thawed out Sylvester Stallone for this junk I have no idea. This is clearly one of those international co-productions meant for foreign audiences. This is not always a bad thing. Bloodrayne is an awful movie filled with international stars but it is also a fun movie filled with sex, violence and hammy acting. This honestly has no action, nudity or violence. Just a bunch of nobodies wandering around a set from 1980's The Apple while some American stars pop in for glorified cameos. More purgatory than Hades I am afraid.
So bad, I thought I must have had a stroke, to explain my utter disconnect from the point of this movie.plus missed a first that established what's going on.. Thank goodness it's not only me.

They try too much to make the "prison"look high-tech that it's just impractical, like the lighting in the cells,  who put those gadgets in the food container, etc. Batista should have been the one inside. It felt like Batista was there just to make the poster look good. The first movie was wayyyyy better.

One of the few real flops that either Bautisa or Stallone have ever done. I loved the first movie, this, due to the obvius influence of the chinese studios, was total crap. The story was interseting, but there was no character develupment, and the entire plot was extreamly shallow with horrable special effects and terrable acting on the part of the chinese action hero character who litterally has one expression the entire movie.

full throttle action and fun!
Wow I can't believe I just spent money to rent this movie. Escape Plan 1 was so damn good. What were they thinking?   I thought Stallone was better than this. I want 90 minutes of my life back.

So where do i begin with such a bad, disappointment, ridiculous movie. Now before anything i would like to say that i respect Sylvester Stallone, and that i have watched many of his movies including the first "Escape Plan". But i don't know why he would ever agree to this mess. This movie's plot didn't make sense at all, the CGI was bad, the camera work was  average if not below average. The first Escape Plan was thrilling, it was what was promised. But this movie was so bad that i might consider this the worst movie i've seen. The action doesn't even seem like it's in a cinematic movie, the solutions to the problems are stupid. And it is so fast paced that it becomes weird. Just save your money.

I have never gone out of my way to review any movie, but this one is so rank, I was compelled to. Save yourself 2 hours and do something more useful. Nonsensical plot, edited by a moron with rubbish acting. Give it a wide berth.

Oh boy, the cover post with Stallone and Bautista sure fooled us! Like the first Escape Plan movie in which Arnold Schwarzenegger and Sylvester Stallone were the two main actors, Escape Plan 2 tricks you into thinking Stallone and Bautista would be the main actors. Instead you get a convoluted story in which Huang Xiaoming is the main actor playing Shu. The story, however, does pick up 2/3rds of the way through the movie when Stallone as Ray finally joins the prison to help Shu escape. 

One of the biggest differences I noticed right away between the first movie and this second one was the limited budget on explosions. They used way too much CGI, poor at that, to create fire and explosions, which really diminishes the action scenes. I miss the days when Hollywood used actual explosions and real fire (I mean, fake fire but "real") to make explosive action sequences. 

There are so many things wrong with this movie, but it's also an interesting story and if you can bypass the awkward scenes and the lack of Stallone and Bautista, it's enjoyable... but probably better to wait until it's free. After watching Escape Plan 2, to me it's no surprise this movie didn't make it to theaters and went straight to OnDemand and Redbox.
This was a great movie. Typical Stallone. If you don't like him, don't watch it. But if you do, it''s great

Way to sloooooooow.  Not worth the price.

I never write reviews, but I made an account solely to write a review for this. I'm trying to think of a movie that has a more incoherent plot, but I can't. I'm trying to think of a movie that has characters that you care less about, but I can't. The deceptive poster and billing (that Sly and Bautista are stars when in fact they are hardly in it) is not even among the top 5 worst things about this movie. 1) Story is incoherent. No scene relates to the previous one or the next. I couldn't tell you what I just saw, and I was paying attention. 2) Characters are written to not care about them. 3) No clear antagonist. 4) No clear caper. 5) Characters don't behave like real people. For example, *in the middle of a car chase,* the driver calls another character to explain who he is chasing so that the viewer understands the exposition dump. I know that when I pursue someone in a high speed chase, I always ring my bud to inform him of what I'm doing for no reason at all.

I imagine Hades is a place where they force you to watch Escape Plan 2 on a loop. No Schwarzenegger and Stallone shows up just long enough to collect his paycheck. If there is anything redeeming about this VOD cash grab it is literally the last half hour when Breslin (Stallone) finally has something to do with the story. It isn't good, but almost "Stallone bad"... almost. The first Escape Plan was enjoyably lowbrow while Escape Plan 2: Hades is depressingly low budget, and hold on to your barf bags because we're facing down an Escape Plan trilogy. The third (Devil's Station) having been shot back to back with part 2... This is not a good sign. Also, Bautista is awesome and I am genuinely shocked by how much I like him as an actor, but his presence here feels nothing short of whorish.
Escape Plan 2 was a sequel i wanted to see. Disappointing acting, average special effects and a acceptable story. Even as a DVD/Digital release this movie is a pass sadly.
Really BAD. Cannot really see a real story here.

If I can give this a 10th of a stat, I would. Like 90% of all of the movie viewers, I just turned it off after 15 minutes. It wasn't as interesting as the first movie. I could see that there were new film production companies producing the movie. They weren't very popular and large production companies. I could tell this was specifically made for the Chinese market. The new actors weren't very good at the acting, as seen from the first minute of the movie. Just another sequel. I wonder what the third movie has in store for us....

Terrible acting. Terrible directing. The story is pure garbage. There's absolutely no point to the story at all and the film does nearly nothing to even care that you don't know what is happening. Stallone is not the focus like in the first movie. The advertising is completely misleading, as the main protagonist is a terrible foreign actor who couldn't successfully play a sock puppet in a play for 2-year-olds if his life depended on it. He could, however, kick and punch his way out of a wet paper bag if that entertains you. The entire film forfeits itself to the so-called success the first one had overseas and it shows. It's a low-rate, crap kung-fu film. This really, really, really sucks. Stallone should be ashamed and embarrassed that he would take part in this abomination. It feels like I got duped and he could care a less that he's putting out garbage like this for his long-time fans. This is just terrible. I hate this movie, and I hate his fake face.

I do not understand how it's possible that this movie was made. It is unimaginably terrible. Just....how? When they were making this movie they had to know it was shit. How could anyone involved in this movie let it be released?

The movie is its own thing so dont expect a remake of the first movie...  It has a alot of things i liked and a few things i didnt.. Youll see what i mean when you get there. it´s difficult to rate this movie. if you expect a sequel to the straightforward escape plan 1, you´ll definitely dislike this. we´re in a pure sci-fi movie here. it´s a completely different animal. now: if this goes on like this, presenting a new approach with every new movie (like in alien 1, 2, 3 , 4 ... not comparing quality here) this might be interesting ... although i doubt this will go on at all. but the main problem of the movie is the neverending, permanently annoying score that tries to copy bladerunner atmosphere in a new-generation approach, failing completely. too much, too loud, too off.
